intro: Sporobolus smutsii, commonly known as Smuts' needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and fine, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Sporobolus smutsii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native range.
